forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 5am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. Southwest wind 7 to 12 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. West wind 7 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

weather_report:
As evening settles over Downtown San Francisco, the atmosphere bears hints of the rain that might grace the city until the early hours. The clouds hang low and heavy, weaving a patchwork of gray across the skyline. With a breezy southwest wind playing gently among the streets, it’s a reminder of the ever-shifting coastal weather that blankets the Bay Area. The temperature hugs around fifty-two, inviting a sense of cozy introspection. One might wander along the waterfront, where the whisper of the ocean mingles with the muted hum of the city, finding solace in the sound of raindrops if they arrive, each one a promise of renewal.

As Friday dawns, the skies are expected to clear, giving way to a sun-drenched day that would see temperatures inching toward sixty before softening into the afternoon. For now, however, the looming cloud cover casts a somber charm over the urban landscape. Those venturing outdoors would do well to dress in layers—a light jacket will suffice against the evening chill, which gives way to the crisp embrace of the morning. Activities might include a leisurely stroll through the quiet streets or perhaps a gentle sip of coffee as the world stirs awake. With the promise of sunshine on the horizon, today might just be the day to plan for an outdoor gathering, warm sweaters and all, basking in the light that will soon pierce through the clouds.
